timeline.message:
Support failure recovery for replica removal

When decommissioning a replica(remove replica), there are three
transitions to go through and node may crash at any point. This PR adds
additional logic to help node resume decommission after restart. One
thing to keep in mind is, if replica has been removed from IdealState in
Helix, after rebooting the node, Helix always drags replica being
removed to OFFLINE state (no matter what previous state it was before
failure) and directly triggers OFFLINE -> DROPPED. Hence, most of
failure recovery logic is inserted into Offline-To-Dropped transition.
add test case and remove unnecessary code in AmbryServerRequests
